title: Phoenix Chief Says Police Response to Incident with 4-year-old Is 'unacceptable'

annotations.text: this is one of the most insane attacks on a black family, or any family, that I've ever seen law enforcement engage in
annotations.openFeedback: This characterizes the incident as among the most extreme attacks ever seen, amplifying its severity in a way that likely overstates and dramatizes the event.

title: Four Top Residencies Now Offered to Local Artists, Thanks to Oolite

annotations.text: a new opportunity to superpower their careers
annotations.openFeedback: The verb 'superpower' is an exaggeration, making the opportunity sound artificially more transformative and impactful than a more neutral term like 'advance' or 'improve' would.

title: Port of L.a. Sued After Canceling Agreement for a Shipping Container Facility

annotations.text: a green, job-creating project is stymied by a single entity for their own narrow reasons
annotations.openFeedback: This blames a single group for blocking a beneficial project and harming the city, framing them as the main obstacle and assigning broad responsibility to that entity.

annotations.text: they [ILWU] run the Port,
annotations.openFeedback: This quote, reported in the lawsuit, blames a single group (the ILWU) for having undue control over the port, thereby framing them as the reason the project could not move forward.

annotations.text: a green, job-creating project is stymied by a single entity for their own narrow reasons,
annotations.openFeedback: This quote from the company's CEO blames a single group (the union) for the failure of a project, framing them as a selfish obstacle to progress for the entire city.

annotations.text: a green, job-creating project is stymied by a single entity for their own narrow reasons
annotations.openFeedback: This quote overstates the situation by implying one entity alone blocked a broadly beneficial project for purely narrow reasons, simplifying and amplifying blame.

annotations.text: a green, job-creating project is stymied by a single entity for their own narrow reasons
annotations.openFeedback: The statement reduces a complex dispute involving multiple actors and regulatory steps to a single cause, suggesting that only one entity is responsible for stopping the project.

title: Get These Trending Washington Restaurants on Your Radar Today

annotations.text: Astoria DC bagged a staggering 141.7% increase in new reviews within that timeframe
annotations.openFeedback: The word 'staggering' is a subjective adjective used to make the statistical increase sound more dramatic and impressive than the number might otherwise seem on its own.

title: Protest in Madrid as Conservatives Suspend Ban on Most Polluting Cars

annotations.text: raising fears that environmental rollbacks seen in the United States may be spreading to Europe
annotations.openFeedback: This phrase amplifies concern by suggesting a broad spread of U.S.-style rollbacks to Europe without concrete evidence, making the threat sound larger and more imminent.

annotations.text: "Yes we can, I do want Madrid central," chanted the protesters.
annotations.openFeedback: The article quotes a chant from protesters, which functions as a slogan to rally support for their cause and simplify their message into a memorable phrase.

annotations.text: Some were holding banners that read "I want to breathe free"
annotations.openFeedback: The article quotes a phrase from a protest banner. This is a short, memorable phrase designed to spark emotion and support for a cause, which is the definition of a slogan.

title: Missouri's Only Abortion Clinic to Remain Open After Judge's Injunction Holds

annotations.text: the embattled health center
annotations.openFeedback: The phrase uses a loaded descriptor that frames the clinic as under siege, adding emotional coloring rather than neutral description.

annotations.text: medically unnecessary hoops and regulations
annotations.openFeedback: This phrase amplifies the burden and dismisses regulations wholesale as unnecessary, overstating their nature in a value-laden way.

annotations.text: another medically unnecessary requirement that the state was putting on it to whittle down Missouri residents' access to abortion
annotations.openFeedback: This wording portrays the regulation as purely obstructive and part of a deliberate effort to reduce access, simplifying and intensifying the state’s motives.

annotations.text: to whittle down Missouri residents' access to abortion
annotations.openFeedback: This phrase, attributed to Planned Parenthood, ascribes a malicious intent to the state's regulators, suggesting their goal is to deliberately diminish people's healthcare access. This frames the state's actions as a harmful effort, which aligns with demonization.
